text: this is Michael and I'm the man who
rescues dogs a native of Sweden Michael
first came to Bangkok 16 years ago as a
chef but on one afternoon in 2011 his
life changed so in 2011 one dog showed
up behind my restaurant and I start to
feed that dog that the dog was in very
bad shape and after that I just it just
escalated and that was a start for me to
rescue stray dogs in Thailand in
Thailand there are more than 2 million
Street dogs dogs which are ownerless
abandon or free ranging they are seen
all over Bangkok side streets and sadly
most of them are treated poorly they are
starving skinny and sick often covered
with scabs or fleas many of Thailand
Street dogs don't live longer than a few
years but thankfully Michael has come to
the rescue
I have since 2011 rescued about $1500
I'm here at his home slash dog warehouse
which is one hour southeast of Bangkok
in the countryside this is my blueberry
come on he was dumped in the forest with
a muscle on him chained to a tree for
three days hmm but the government should

neuter and education and spend money on
that you cannot go every year and sort
of kill like hundred thousand dogs every
it doesn't have you need to fix the
problem but it's not a dog problem it's

guy my name's fresca DoCoMo I've been
here for three days with the man that

your first impression you might see a

a day
they're safe from the streets and you
really get to see how happy they are
it's incredible it's not really sad like

the dog is healthier I bring the dog

that's about a dollar a day the

attend with people as he has been taking

that he actually has a sixth sense to
